page.title: 13ASTLEY BRIDGE FARM (2)
page.content: There are many animals kept at Astley Bridge Farm.These include ducks that live near the river during the summer and in sheds near the duck pool in the winter.They also have cows and calves Some of the calves have been bought at local markets.They are kept in sheds while the cows go out into the fields. The cattle are sold for beef at a live market and are often sent abroad for food.The farm has 650 lambs and about 400 sheep.The sheep are dipped in a mixture of water and disinfectent twice a year and they are sheared in the summer.They have twelve sheep dogs and four pups.Mr Calcutt keeps the dogs as a hobby.
